name.namePart: United States District Court Eastern District of California

titleInfo.title: (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 11/6/2014 ORDERING the clerk to randomly assign a District Judge and to serve a copy of this order on Monica Anderson and the Warden of CSP- Sacramento. District Judge Troy L. Nunley RANDOMLY ASSIGNED to this case. It is HEREBY RECOMMENDED that 3 Plaintiff's Motion be partially granted. It is FURTHER RECOMMENDED that defendants be directed to provide plaintiff with as many copies of his petition for habeas corpus as are required to make a complete submission with the Calfornia Supreme Court in sufficient time to meet his 11/25/2014 deadline and provide plaintiff with one additional copy. Referred to Judge Troy L. Nunley. Objections due within 7 days after being served with these findings and recommendations. (CC- Monica Anderson) (Donati, J)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by District Judge Troy L. Nunley on 11/14/14 ADOPTING 5 Findings and Recommendations in full and GRANTING 3 Motion for Temporary Restraining Order. (Donati, J)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 12/9/2014 RECOMMENDING that plaintiff's 1 complaint be dismissed with prejudice, with the proviso that this dismissal shall not act as a bar to plaintiff filing a petition for writ of habeas corpus at the federal level once he properly exhausts State collateral review with respect to the judgment or claim he is challenging at the California Supreme Court; plaintiff's 2 request for leave to proceed in forma pauperis be denied as moot; and this case be closed. Referred to Judge Troy L. Nunley; Objections due within 14 days. (Yin, K)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:14-cv-02580; (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California

Referred to Judge Troy L. Nunley; Objections due within 14 days. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 1/5/15 ORDERING that the findings and recommendations filed on December 9, 2014 8 are vacated; and Defendants are directed to file and serve one or more declarations addressing (i) whether defendant was provided with sufficient copies of his petition for a writ of habeas corpus to make a timely and complete submission with the California Supreme Court, as ordered by the court on November 14, 2014, and if he was not so provided, (ii) the reasons for the omission, and (iii) what steps defendants are taking to ensure that plaintiff can make a proper filing with the California Supreme Court, particularly in light of the fact that it appears plaintiff has missed his filing deadline. These declarations must be filed with the court and served on defendant no later than January 12, 2015, at 4:30 p.m.(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 1/23/2015 GRANTING plaintiff's 2 request to proceed IFP; plaintiff shall pay the $350.00 filing fee in accordance with the concurrent CDCR order; claims against defendants McCumber and Hamad are DISMISSED with leave to amend within 30 days, plaintiff is not obliged to amend his complaint; service is appropriate for Kemp, Bradford, Triche and Dennehy; the Clerk shall provide plaintiff with forms for service which plaintiff may complete and return within 30 days; plaintiff shall return the Notice of Submission or Amendment with response; paragragh two of the 1/5/2015 order (ECF No. 11 at 3:7-15) is VACATED; within 21 days, Supervising Deputy AG Monica Anderson shall file a response to plaintiff's contention that he cannot file his petition for writ of habeas corpus in the CA Supreme Court because he needs fourteen copies and was only provided two copies; and the Clerk shall send a copy of this order to Monica Anderson. (cc: Monica Anderson) (Yin, K)

(cc: Monica Anderson) (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Goods v. McCumber, et al.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER DIRECTING MONTHLY PAYMENTS be made from Prison Account of Gregory Goods signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 1/23/2015. CDCR shall collect an initial partial filing fee and thereafter the balance in monthly payments and forward to the Clerk until the $350.00 filing fee is paid in full. The Clerk is directed to serve this order and copy of plaintiff's IFP on the Director of CDCR. The Clerk shall also serve Financial with a copy of this order. (cc: CDCR, Financial)(Yin, K)
